The sounds seem to be even louder n piercing his soul. FERREIRA (cont'd) Have you found the words on the wall? “Laudate Eum.” “Praise him.” I cut them there with a stone. When I was in this cell, like you. Do you think you are the only one who doubted? The only one who called on God’s help and love and got only silence in return?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Be quiet! You have no right to speak to me!  122 109

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: I do because you are just like me. You see Jesus in Gethsemane and believe your trial is the same as His. Those five in the pit are suffering too, just like Jesus, but they don’t have your pride. They would never compare themselves to Jesus. Do you have the right to make them suffer? I heard the cries of suffering in this same cell. And I acted.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Don’t try to excuse yourself! That is the spirit of darkness disguised as light!

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: What would you do for them? Pray? And get what in return? Only more suffering. A suffering only you can end. Not God.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Go away from me!

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: I prayed too. It doesn’t help. Go on. Pray. Two Guards enter the cell and yank Rodrigues to his feet. FERREIRA (cont'd) But pray with your eyes open. Rodrigues is handled roughly, and CRIES OUT in pain. His MIXED WITH the sounds from outside, which are...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. INQUISITOR’S OLD PRISON YARD NIGHT (PRE-DAWN) 122 ...the AGONIES of FIVE CHRISTIANS strung up, upside down, a gaping pit of offal and filth. Blood drips slowly from their ears. They moan in pain and desperation. The Interpreter and Ferreira stand on either side of the stunned Rodrigues. He has never been so close to their suffering, and the sight of it is like a mortal wound.  He quiets continue. 110

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: You can spare them. They call out for help, just as you call to God. He is silent. But you do not have to be.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: God help me, they should apostatize... (yelling at them) Apostatize! Korobu! Korobe!

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: But they have apostatized. Many times over. They are here for you, Rodrigues. As long as you don’t apostatize they cannot be saved.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: (desperate) They are suffering now but they will receive their reward in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: Don’t make a mockery of those beautiful words. You’re only trying to hide your fear. Do you really believe what you said?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: I believe!

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: You believe in yourself! You set yourself above them. It’s your salvation that obsesses you, not theirs. You dread to be the dregs of the church, like me. Is that your way of love? A priest should act in imitation of Christ. If Christ were here... for a moment, calming himself. The MOANS from the pit Ferreira resumes in a strong, rational voice. FERREIRA (cont'd) If Christ were here He would have acted. Apostatized. For their sake. Christ would certainly have done at least that to help men.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: (covering his face with his hands ) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 RODRIGUES (cont'd) No, no....Christ is here. I just can’t hear Him.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: Can you love? Can you love as God commands? Rodrigues cannot answer.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: Show God you love Him. Save the lives of the people He loves. The Interpreter steps forward CARRYING THE FUMIE, which h places on the ground before Rodrigues.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: There is something more important than the judgement of the church....you will never do anything more important than this... Ferreira puts his arms around Rodrigues.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: You are now going to fulfill the most painful act of love that has ever been performed. Rodrigues stands over the fumie. The image of Christ star at him.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: (a voice of quiet command) Courage. Ferreira moves aside.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Let this cup pass from me.” Rodrigues leans down and picks up the fumie, holding it c to his face. The fumie is sticky with dirt and blood, the image of Chr grimy with the marks of many feet. But the picture is fam Rodrigues looks upon it. He presses the fumie to his face, then places it back on floor. From somewhere nearby he HEARS...  112

dialogues.speaker: INTERPRETER
dialogues.text: (gently) It’s only a formality. Justa formality. Rodrigues now has his foot over the fumie. As Rodrigues looks down, the face of Christ CHANGES TO: h beloved IMAGE OF CHRIST FROM THE EVORA CHAPEL. CUT TO: Rodrigues' face, also CHANGING. Is this a sign? T sign he has been waiting for? He HEARS JESUS, speaking to at last--with gentle understanding.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF JESUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Come ahead now. It’s all right. Step on Me. I understand your pain. I was born into this world to share men’s pain. I carried this cross for your pain. Step.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) Oh Jesus....

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF JESUS
dialogues.text: Your life is with Me now. Show Me your love. And his foot touches the fumie...the beautiful face he lo from the Evora chapel...the face he loved most in the wor His foot seems to sink through the picture, into the grou pulling Rodrigues down, absorbing him, subsuming him.... .+.-past his ankle...past his leg...until he is on his kn top of the picture of Christ. On the unyielding ground. He is sobbing. The ground is solid. Ferreira, the Interpreter and the guards all watch silent At the window of the Inquisitor’s office across the court Inoue TURNS AWAY, satisfied. After a moment, the Interpreter SIGNALS and the Guards st remove the Five Christians from the pit. Only the CROWING of a rooster at the approaching dawn bre the silence.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO

And, again, children dash through the streets, swinging LANTER the slowly falling darkness, singing the holiday song. From the window of a small house, Rodrigues watches them He is DRESSED IN A KIMONO. His hair is pulled back and ti Some of the children shout to him in Japanese “Apostate P He can’t hear it. He smiles. The smile is sad. But all th tension has gone from his face. The pain has vanished.

dialogues.text: Christian. Not Christian.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Christian, obviously.

dialogues.text: “Our ships were searched to warrant we were not smuggling religious objects. Even my surgical knives and bleeding bowl were closely examined. Neither foreign coins nor anything bearing the images of the cross, a saint, or rosary could pass. DIETER ALBRECHT continues to watch carefully and makes hi notes as the priests continue their work.

Other CLERKS regard them with be contempt. Rodrigues looks away from them as the Japanese scornfully dispose of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: We were taught to love those who scorn us.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: I feel nothing for them.  115

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Only Our Lord can judge your heart. Ferreira turns away, a guard staying close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: You said “Our” Lord.

dialogues.speaker: FERREIRA
dialogues.text: I doubt it. Ferreira walks away, not looking back.

dialogues.text: “By this time, I observed he had acquired considerable skill with the language, and seemed, I must tell you, to be at peace with his situation.”

dialogues.text: LATE AUTUMN. Rodrigues before Inoue, who treats him with scrupulous politeness as he warms his hands over a brazie

dialogues.speaker: INOUE
dialogues.text: I have good news. A man has died in Edo. Okada San'emon. You will take his name just as it is.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: INOUE
dialogues.text: He had a household. And a wife. You can take her as your wife. A man works best when he is not alone.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: INOUE
dialogues.text: (beat) You know, Okada...does that sound strange to you?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Not as much as I thought.

dialogues.speaker: INOUE
dialogues.text: (faint smile) On Ikitsuki and Goto there are still many farmers who think themselves Kirishitan. Do you like that? They can continue to do so. You may take some satisfaction in that. (Rodrigues bows his head) The roots are cut.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: Nothing grows in a swamp.

dialogues.speaker: INOUE
dialogues.text: (nods; beat) Japan is that kind of country. It can not be helped. The religion of the Kirishitan you brought us has become a strange thing. It’s changed. You were not defeated by me. You were defeated by this swamp of Japan.

dialogues.text: Rodrigues accepts a cup of tea with a nod of thanks to...Kichijiro, who waits while Rodrigues sips the tea.

dialogues.speaker: KICHIJIRO
dialogues.text: I heard the Inquisitor sent his men for you. Was there trouble?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: They were only here to make sure I wrote the korobi shomon. My latest oath of renunciation. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KICHIJIRO
dialogues.text: You have nothing to thank me for.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: For being here with me.

dialogues.speaker: KICHIJIRO
dialogues.text: (carefully) Padre...

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: No no. Not any more. I’m a fallen priest.

dialogues.speaker: KICHIJIRO
dialogues.text: But you’re the last priest left. You could still hear my confession.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: No. I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: KICHIJIRO
dialogues.text: I still suffer for what I did, Padre. I betrayed you, I betrayed my family. I betrayed our Lord. Please....hear my confession... As Rodrigues WATCHES him with sympathy, WE HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lord, I fought against Your silence.  130 118 CUT TO: Kichijiro, BOWING his head. CUT TO: Rodrigues, LOOKING at him. CUT TO: Kichijiro, head still bowed as Rodrigues believes HEARS HIM SAY...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF JESUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I suffered beside you. I was never silent. Kichijiro’s lips have not moved. His head remains bowed. Cut back to: Rodrigues, REACHING OUT his hand and resting gently on top of Kichijiro’s head. When he speaks it is t answer the voice he is sure he has heard.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUES
dialogues.text: I know. But even if God had been silent, my life...to this very day...everything I do...everything I've done...speaks of Him. It was in the silence that I heard Your voice. And he begins the words of the sacrament as WE HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: DIETER ALBRECHT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “The Inquisitor continued to insist on periodic examinations of all suspected Christians.”
